Mercury::PacketFilter

Mercury::PacketFilter Class Reference

This class defines an interface that can be used to filter packets coming into or out of a channel. More...

Detailed Description

This class defines an interface that can be used to filter packets coming into or out of a channel.

Member Function Documentation

virtual int Mercury::PacketFilter::maxSpareSize (  )  [inline, virtual]

Return the max spare amount that you need, so the Bundle knows to leave at least that much room.

Reimplemented in Mercury::EncryptionFilter.

Reason Mercury::PacketFilter::recv ( PacketReceiver &  receiver,
const Address &  addr,
Packet *  pPacket,
ProcessSocketStatsHelper *  pStatsHelper 
) [virtual]

Documented in header file.

You should return a Reason (if it is not REASON_SUCCESS then an exception will be thrown with that Reason). Calling this base class method from your own recv is necessary to get Mercury to process the packet after you have finished filtering it. You may call it multiple (or no) times if you wish.

Reimplemented in Mercury::EncryptionFilter.

Reason Mercury::PacketFilter::send ( NetworkInterface &  networkInterface,
const Address &  addr,
Packet *  pPacket 
) [virtual]

This method is called when Mercury wants to send a packet.

It should return a Mercury::Reason. The base class implementation sends it over the nub's socket with a few retries if error conditions are signalled. Calling this base class method from your own send is recommended.

Reimplemented in Mercury::EncryptionFilter.
